entries.name: new(filename, mode = 0666)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new database handle by opening the given filename. SDBM actually uses two physical files, with extensions '.dir' and '.pag'. These extensions will automatically be appended to the filename.

entries.name: sdbm[key] → value or nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the value in the database associated with the given key string.

entries.name: sdbm[key] = value      → valueclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Stores a new value in the database with the given key as an index.

entries.name: clear → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Deletes all data from the database.

entries.name: close → nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Closes the database file.

entries.name: closed? → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database is closed.

entries.name: delete(key) → value or nilclick to toggle source
delete_if { |key, value| ... } → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Iterates over the key-value pairs in the database, deleting those for which the block returns true.

entries.name: empty? → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database is empty.

entries.name: fetch(key) → value or nilclick to toggle source
has_key?(key) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database contains the given key.

entries.name: has_value?(key) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database contains the given value.

entries.name: include?(key) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database contains the given key.

entries.name: invert → Hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a Hash in which the key-value pairs have been inverted.

entries.name: key(value) → keyclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the key associated with the given value. If more than one key corresponds to the given value, then the first key to be found will be returned. If no keys are found, nil will be returned.

entries.name: key?(key) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database contains the given key.

entries.name: keys → Arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a new Array containing the keys in the database.

entries.name: length → integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the number of keys in the database.

entries.name: member?(key) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database contains the given key.

entries.name: reject { |key, value| ... } → Hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new Hash using the key-value pairs from the database, then calls Hash#reject with the given block, which returns a Hash with only the key-value pairs for which the block returns false.

entries.name: reject!   { |key, value| ... } → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Iterates over the key-value pairs in the database, deleting those for which the block returns true.

entries.name: replace(pairs) → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Empties the database, then inserts the given key-value pairs.

entries.name: select { |key, value| ... } → Arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a new Array of key-value pairs for which the block returns true.

entries.name: shift → Array or nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Removes a key-value pair from the database and returns them as an Array. If the database is empty, returns nil.

entries.name: size → integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the number of keys in the database.

entries.name: store(key, value) → valueclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Stores a new value in the database with the given key as an index.

entries.name: to_a → Arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a new Array containing each key-value pair in the database.

entries.name: to_hash → Hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a new Hash containing each key-value pair in the database.

entries.name: update(pairs) → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Insert or update key-value pairs.

entries.name: value?(key) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns true if the database contains the given value.

entries.name: values → Arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a new Array containing the values in the database.

entries.name: values_at(key, ...) → Arrayclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an Array of values corresponding to the given keys.
